availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas F. Daulton (Mason County, Kentucky, livery stable keeper and justice of the peace)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, livery stable keeper and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Frances Williams Daulton. Father of Henry D. Daulton, Moses Daulton, Mary Daulton, Frances Daulton, Anna Daulton, and Kate Daulton. Livery stable keeper in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Mason County in 1850. Livery stable keeper in Mason County from 1860 to 1864. Justice of the peace in Mason County from 1863 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 54A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville.

Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 391D.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994048, Mason County Births, p. 6.
[Untitled], Maysville Weekly Bulletin, (Maysville, KY), 19 June 1862, p. 3.
"August Ellection of 1864- Official," Maysville Weekly Bulletin, (Maysville, KY), 11 Aug 1864, p. 2.
"Notice to the Tax-Payers of Mason County," Maysville Weekly Bulletin, (Maysville, KY), 22 Sep 1864, p.3.
"Thomas Fristoe Daulton (1807-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial 13784408, accessed March 27, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/13784408.
